posts.title: Fayetteville Chuy's Prepares To Open February 2023
posts.content:
Chuy's, the well-known Tex-Mex restaurant with Austin origins, is set to open its second Northwest Arkansas location this winter in Fayetteville. 

  • Round the corner: The Fayetteville Chuy's will open at 642 E. Millsap Rd, conveniently down the road from Washington Regional hospital, where they can treat the food coma you're sure to be in - it's nearly impossible to stop once you start in on that creamy jalepe√±o dip. 
  • Target date: The restaurant aims to open in February 2023 and is thrilled to share its passion for food and unique atmosphere. 

Stay up to date with the Fayetteville Chuy's HERE.

posts.title: Demand  For Multifamily Real Estate Holding Strong In Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
While slower than 2021's market, this year's demand for multifamily residential properties has held firm. 

  • Crunching the numbers: Thirty-two multifamily trades occurred across Northwest Arkansas during the first ten months of 2022, totaling $280m and reaching an all-time high average unit price of $139,742. 
  • Drawn by growth: The article credited the increase in multifamily investments to the area's booming economy, strong population growth, and increasing rent rates.  

Read the full article on Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Ranked 60th Best College Town In The US
posts.content:
WalletHub recognized Fayetteville on its list of the Best College Towns in the U.S. 

  • Rubric: WalletHub's survey considered wallet-friendliness, social environment, and academic/economic opportunities available to students. 
  • Keep it small: Fayetteville received high marks for its social and academic/economic environment and came in at 27 in the small town category. 

View the entire list HERE.

posts.title: Mount Sequoyah Hosts NWA Festival of Trees
posts.content:
The NWA Festival of Trees began Monday at Mount Sequoyah Center in Fayetteville, kicking off a two-week celebration in honor of the center's 100th year of providing programs on the mountain. 

  • Winter wonderland: Businesses, individuals, and community organizations can sponsor trees and wreaths to display during the event, with proceeds benefitting the restoration and preservation of the historic site. 
  • Let the fun begin: Festivities include caroling nights, pictures with Santa, the Wampus Wonderland Christmas Fair, and the Cheers to 100 Years Cocktail Party on Dec 10 from 5-7p. 

Find a full schedule of the event HERE.

posts.title: Downtown Bentonville Market Moves Indoors For The Winter
posts.content:
Downtown Bentonville's annual Market @ Record begins this weekend, providing an indoor version of the Farmer's Market throughout the cold winter months. 

  • On the record: Market @ Record will feature a rotating lineup of local vendors every Saturday 9a-12p from Dec 3 until Mar 18, excluding New Year's Eve. 
  • Breaking records: The Bentonville Farmer's Market had a record-breaking year in 2022, earning $1.7m in sales this season. 

Find more information HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Raised Wright: Connect with your child's heart and give them a lasting way to hear their father's voice by joining the Legacy Letter Challenge during a private dinner at Wright's Barbecue in Rogers on Dec 5.*
  • Become a Barnstormer: Applications are open for the 2023-24 academic year to the #1 Private School in Arkansas: Thaden School.*
  • My hero: Bella Vista fire department came to the rescue of a dog stuck in a drainage culvert last week, helping the pup make it home in time for Thanksgiving. 
  • Classroom: J.B. Hunt's Adopt-a-Class program will provide $55,000 to elementary classrooms throughout the country. 
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
